headline: Robins: 4 Eggs, 4 Weeks
text: I love how, in spring, the world is transformed overnight from a silent, brooding place into a riot of colour, exploding with the cries of hungry baby birds, each one a hope for the future.    This charming video captures a pair of American robins, Turdus migratorius, that nested in a hanging basket of flowers on the videographer's porch. Through the four week period of filming, the video captures the hen patiently incubating her clutch of four pale blue eggs through rain and shine, and then follows the parents raising their hungry chicks, starting by feeding worms that are nearly as big as each newly-hatched chick, until the youngsters leave home. I think the end is particularly amusing and touching.       [video link]  .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. ..
